questionText: What is the difference between a CPU and a GPU?
options: A CPU is for graphics, a GPU is for general tasks
A CPU has fewer, more powerful cores; a GPU has thousands of smaller cores

correctAnswer: A CPU has fewer, more powerful cores; a GPU has thousands of smaller cores

correctAnswer: Storing data permanently, even when the power is off

questionText: What is an Operating System (OS)?

correctAnswer: Software that manages computer hardware and software resources

questionText: Which of the following is NOT a core function of an Operating System?

questionText: What is a Kernel in an Operating System?

correctAnswer: The core component that manages all system resources

correctAnswer: Translating assembly language to machine code

questionText: Which language is written in binary code (0s and 1s)?

correctAnswer: A compiler translates the entire program at once; an interpreter translates and executes line by line

questionText: What is a Monolithic Kernel?

correctAnswer: A kernel where all OS services run in a single address space

correctAnswer: A deceptive attempt to obtain sensitive information by impersonating a trustworthy entity

correctAnswer: A Hub broadcasts data to all ports; a Switch sends data only to the intended destination

correctAnswer: A virus requires a host program to spread; a worm can spread on its own
